definition: large place used for a specific purpose/stage/scene (of a play)/classifier for sporting or recreational activities/classifier for number of exams
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: From the Coliseum, Go Back Through the Gate of Constantine.
sentences.chinese: 從古羅馬競技場，往回經過君士坦丁之門。

sentences.english: You shall not kill other players, except PVP, Battle ground or Arena.
sentences.chinese: 汝不可殺玩家，除非是在PVP，戰場或競技場。

sentences.english: Arena Points rewards oughta be self-explanatory.
sentences.chinese: 競技場獎勵是務須多說的。

sentences.english: The competitors cantered into the arena to conclude the closing ceremony.
sentences.chinese: 選手們慢跑進入競技場，爲閉幕式畫上了句號。

sentences.english: Do not sucked into arena and the rating systems.
sentences.chinese: 別沉迷在競技場和積分系統。

sentences.english: In the arena but not off place, you can do not fear aches!
sentences.chinese: 競技場可是不講情面的地方哦，可不要怕疼啊。

sentences.english: As the young man entered the public arena, he turned to bend to the king.
sentences.chinese: 隨着青年進入競技場，他向國王彎身致敬。

sentences.english: Some famous amphitheatres were built by the Romans.
sentences.chinese: 一些著名的競技場都是羅馬人修建的。

sentences.english: The Roman Amphitheater is the symbol of Casterbridge.
sentences.chinese: 羅馬競技場是卡斯特橋的代表物。

sentences.english: The arena has influenced the design of modern stadiums.
sentences.chinese: 該競技場對現代運動場的設計產生了影響。

sentences.english: I want to see the amphitheaters there.
sentences.chinese: 我想去看那兒的競技場。
競技場的夜景，羅馬，意大利，1970。

sentences.english: What do you think about PVE arenas?
sentences.chinese: 你們對PVE競技場有什麼計劃？

sentences.english: The Colosseum says a lot about the Romans.
sentences.chinese: 古羅馬圓形競技場會告訴我們很多關於羅馬人的故事。

sentences.english: The Coliseum was used for shows until 608 AD.
sentences.chinese: 競技場的演出用途到了公元608年才告結束。

sentences.english: Only professionals can get in the ring during a bullfight.
sentences.chinese: 只有職業選手纔可以在鬥牛時進入競技場。

definition: Tokyo, capital of Japan/Tonkin (northern Vietnam during the French colonial period)
to spar/to fight/to duke it out
